message.content:
cs.LG, cs.ST, cs.IT, cs.AI, cs.SI

The paper deals with the problem of drift in data, which is a common issue in machine learning and data analysis. The paper proposes a probability theoretical framework to formalize drift in continuous time, which is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. The most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), as the paper discusses machine learning methodologies in the presence of drift. The second likely sub-category is cs.ST (Statistics), as the paper proposes a statistical framework to deal with drift. The third likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory), as the paper discusses the stochastic dependency between data and time. The fourth likely sub-category is cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), as the paper deals with a fundamental problem in AI, i.e., how to deal with changing data distributions. The fifth likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), as the paper discusses the decomposition of observed data into a drifting and a non-drifting part, which is relevant to network analysis.
